body: I would like to be assigned this.
This is my first contribution, could you tell me which file the code is to be fixed?

Hi @JamieWalker01, 

Excellent! The first place to look is in the sequential bootsrapped files.
Sorry @Jackal08 , Im not sure what you mean by sequential bootstrapped files, could you explain a bit more?
I think these are the files: https://github.com/hudson-and-thames/mlfinlab/blob/master/mlfinlab/ensemble/sb_bagging.py
You will have to double-check for additional sources but I would start there.

issue.title: Issue 190 fix - future warning

repository.name: mlfinlab
repository.description: MlFinLab helps portfolio managers and traders who want to leverage the power of machine learning by providing reproducible, interpretable, and easy to use tools.

issue.body:
# Description
Changed 
_import sklearn.ensemble.bagging_ 
to
_import sklearn.ensemble_


Fixes Issue #190 

Type of change


- [ ] future warning fix

# How Has This Been Tested?

Please describe the tests that you ran to verify your changes. Provide instructions so we can reproduce. Please also list any relevant details for your test configuration

- [ ] I have ran the import and it does not produce the future warning, It couldn't, however, import BaseBagging from sklearn.ensemble but I presumed this was due to out of date modules on my system. 


**Test Configuration**:
* Operating system  
* IDE used


# Checklist:

- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules

body: It appears the function BaseBagging can not be installed from sklearn.ensemble so is part of the private API in the new version. How would you go about installing it in the code?

issue.title: MlFinLab packages versions update

repository.name: mlfinlab
repository.description: MlFinLab helps portfolio managers and traders who want to leverage the power of machine learning by providing reproducible, interpretable, and easy to use tools.

issue.body:
# Description

In this PR:
- The packages that MlFinLab is using are updated to the latest versions:
  - pandas: 0.25.3 -> 1.0.4
  - numpy: 1.17.3 -> 1.18.5
  - scikit-learn: 0.21.3 -> 0.23.1
  - scipy: 1.3.1 -> 1.4.1
  - matplotlib: 3.1.1 -> 3.2.1
  - cvxpy: 1.0.25 -> 1.1.1
- Travis CI build process is updated:
  - Now pylint shows only important results output and raw metrics tables (no dependency tree and unneeded tables)
  - All Warnings and leaked Errors during unit tests were fixed
  - During the build, only the errors in tests are displayed without unnecessary prints from test functions
  - Previous unit tests + coverage procedure was replaced by only coverage since errors in unit tests will anyways show during coverage test
  - Build time decreased from 40 minutes to 24 minutes
- Some unit tests were adjusted to decrease testing time and adjust to new versions of packages
- Functions that use multiprocessing (labeling, sample weights, sb_bagging, structural breaks) now have an option to silence the report of progress on asynch jobs
- Documentation issues were fixed
- All sphinx warnings were fixed
- Small imbalance sample dataset added


Fixes #190, #197, #228, #249, #313, #335, #356, #358, 

## Type of change

Please delete options that are not relevant.

- [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)

# How Has This Been Tested?

The following changes were tested on all previous MlFinLab unit tests.

Unit test values were changed only if the method algorithms was changed in the used package (mostly scikit-learn's RandomForestClassifier and BaggingClassifier functions). Or if the test dataset was decreased to improve testing time.

**Test Configuration**:
* Windows 10
* PyCharm

# Checklist:

- [x] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [x] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [x] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [x] My changes generate no new warnings
- [x] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [x] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [x] Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules

body:
Hi @JamieWalker01, 

Sorry for the delay, it has actually been a big job and this ticket was part of a much bigger ticket on updating all our package dependencies and updating the code to reflect those changes. 

@PanPip has made all of the adjustments and a new version will go out this weekend. 

Feel free to grab some new tickets. 

Best regards
Jacques Joubert
